metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4439 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Aura in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 108.0.5359.124allowed a remote attacker who convinced the user to engage in specific UIinteractions to potentially exploit heap corruption via specific UIinteractions. (Chromium security severity: High)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-browser-l10n - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-chromedriver - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0.5414.74-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
